data.title: Eagles of Death Metal a misnomer for rockabilly band
data.meta_description: The Nov. 13 terrorist attacks in Paris thrust the band Eagles of Death Metal into the international spotlight when 89 of their concert attendees were killed, as well as a man struck by a bullet in his apartment next to the Bataclan theater.Many people reading and hearing the band’s name may have thought their music […]
data.text:
For information on submitting an obituary, please contact Reading Eagle by phone at 610-371-5018, or email at obituaries@readingeagle.com or fax at 610-371-5193.

Most obituaries published in the Reading Eagle are submitted through funeral homes and cremation services, but we will accept submissions from families. Obituaries can be emailed to obituaries@readingeagle.com.

In addition to the text of the obituary, any photographs that you wish to include can be attached to this email. Please put the text of the obituary in a Word document, a Google document or in the body of the email. The Reading Eagle also requires a way to verify the death, so please include either the phone number of the funeral home or cremation service that is in charge of the deceased's care or a photo of his/her death certificate. We also request that your full name, phone number and address are all included in this email.

All payments by families must be made with a credit card. We will send a proof of the completed obituary before we require payment. The obituary cannot run, however, until we receive payment in full.

Obituaries can be submitted for any future date, but they must be received no later than 3:00 p.m. the day prior to its running for it to be published.

Please call the obituary desk, at 610-371-5018, for information on pricing.

The Nov. 13 terrorist attacks in Paris thrust the band Eagles of Death Metal into the international spotlight when 89 of their concert attendees were killed, as well as a man struck by a bullet in his apartment next to the Bataclan theater.

Many people reading and hearing the band’s name may have thought their music was laden with thrashing guitar work and screaming vocals, but they would be wrong. The Eagles of Death Metal music is really quite eclectic. At times it’s rockabilly, alternative rock, punk and pop.

“I Love You All the Time,” from the band’s fourth and latest album “Zipper Down,” is quite catchy and is ready-for-radio pop. The group performed the tune in Paris at the AccorHotels Arena during U2’s Dec. 7 concert that was shown live on HBO.

Lead singer Jesse Hughes’ vocals on “Wanna Be in LA” from 2008’s “Heart On” seem to invoke Devo, and “I Like to Move In the Night” from 2006’s “Death By Sexy” sounds influenced by the Rolling Stones.

The EODM were formed in 1998 by best friends Hughes and Josh Homme and are based in Palm Desert, Calif. They met in 1987. Homme also is the front man for Queens of the Stone Age. He was not on tour with EODM in Paris.

An explanation of the genesis of the band name is on the official EODM website: “The story goes that a friend was introducing Josh Homme to the death metal genre. When he played a song by the Polish band Vader and made a claim that the song was within the death metal genre, Homme then referred to Vader as “The Eagles of Death Metal.” After hearing this phrase, he wondered what a cross between the Eagles and a death metal band would sound like. With that, the band was born.

Even more enigmatic than the band name is Hughes. He was raised Catholic, is an ordained minister, vocal proponent of right-wing ideals, gun rights, presidential candidate Donald Trump and put out a podcast titled “Our President is a foreign-born Muslim” as Boots Electric Radio on Nov. 10 on Spreaker.com. On the other hand, he is an unabashed drug user (speed and pot according to an Oct. 8 article on Grantland.com), prone to foul language during interviews, is divorced and his girlfriend is ex-porn star Tuesday Cross. He has posed naked with Cross (born Marina Cardenas in 1987), too.

Fast facts

Members of the band playing in Paris were Hughes, bassist Matt McJunkins, guitarist Eden Galindo, drummer Julian Dorio and guitarist Dave Catching.

Hughes, 43, has a teenage son from his marriage that ended in 1998.

Homme, 42, is maried to fellow rocker Brody Dalle (born Bree Joanna Alice Robinson in 1979) and has two children with her: Camille Harley Joan Homme, who will turn 10 on Jan. 17, and Orrin Ryder Homme, 4.

The Eagles of Death Metal will return to Paris Feb. 16 to play at L’Olympia Bruno Coquatrix.

Contact Susan E. Miers Smith: ssmith@readingeagle.com or 610-371-5048.

Originally Published: January 4, 2016 at 12:00 a.m.
